meanings.en: Present in large quantities

exampleSentence: The garden has an abundant supply of vegetables.

meanings.en: Ready to face and endure danger or pain

exampleSentence: The brave firefighter saved the child from the fire.

meanings.en: Eager to know or learn something

exampleSentence: The curious cat explored every corner of the house.

meanings.en: Highly pleasant to the taste

exampleSentence: This homemade cake is absolutely delicious.

meanings.en: Very large in size, quantity, or extent

exampleSentence: The elephant is an enormous animal.

meanings.en: Well known from long or close association

exampleSentence: This song sounds very familiar to me.

meanings.en: Mild in temperament or behavior

exampleSentence: She has a gentle personality and never raises her voice.

meanings.en: Free of deceit and untruthfulness

exampleSentence: He is an honest person who never tells lies.

meanings.en: Having or showing ability to learn and understand

exampleSentence: She is very intelligent and always gets good grades.

meanings.en: Feeling or showing envy of someone

exampleSentence: He felt jealous when he saw her talking to another man.

meanings.en: Achieve or complete successfully

exampleSentence: She accomplished her goal of running a marathon.

meanings.en: Resulting in good; favorable or advantageous

exampleSentence: Exercise is beneficial for both physical and mental health.

meanings.en: A fact or condition connected with or relevant to an event or action

exampleSentence: Under the circumstances, we had to cancel the event.

meanings.en: Clearly show the existence or truth of something

exampleSentence: The scientist demonstrated the experiment to the students.

meanings.en: Intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval

exampleSentence: She showed great enthusiasm for the new project.

meanings.en: The feeling of being upset or annoyed as a result of being unable to change or achieve something

exampleSentence: He expressed his frustration with the slow progress.

meanings.en: The quality of being kind and generous

exampleSentence: Her generosity touched everyone at the charity event.

meanings.en: Pause in indecision before saying or doing something

exampleSentence: Don't hesitate to ask if you need any help.

meanings.en: Certain to happen; unavoidable

exampleSentence: Change is inevitable in today's fast-paced world.

meanings.en: Put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure

exampleSentence: Don't jeopardize your health by working too hard.

meanings.tr: Şans eseri güzel bir keşif yapmak
meanings.en: The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way

exampleSentence: Finding that book was pure serendipity.

meanings.en: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing

exampleSentence: She gave an eloquent speech at the conference.

meanings.en: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise

exampleSentence: He is meticulous about his work.

meanings.en: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically

exampleSentence: We need a pragmatic approach to solve this problem.

meanings.en: Tending to keep a firm hold of something; clinging or adhering closely

exampleSentence: The tenacious athlete never gave up.

meanings.en: The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness

exampleSentence: Her resilience helped her overcome many challenges.

meanings.en: Well meaning and kindly

exampleSentence: Her generosity touched everyone at the charity event.

meanings.en: A person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand

exampleSentence: Her disappearance remains an enigma.

meanings.en: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities

exampleSentence: She is a versatile artist who works in many mediums.

meanings.en: A sentimental longing or wistful affection for the past

exampleSentence: Looking at old photos fills me with nostalgia.

meanings.en: Examine or inspect closely and thoroughly

exampleSentence: The detective scrutinized every piece of evidence.

meanings.en: Clear (someone) of blame or suspicion

exampleSentence: The new evidence will vindicate the accused.

meanings.en: Feeling or showing caution about possible dangers or problems

exampleSentence: Be wary of strangers offering free gifts.

meanings.en: Having or showing zeal

exampleSentence: She is a zealous advocate for human rights.

meanings.en: Truthful and straightforward; frank

exampleSentence: I appreciate your candid feedback.

meanings.en: Lasting for a very short time

exampleSentence: The beauty of cherry blossoms is ephemeral.

meanings.en: Present, appearing, or found everywhere

exampleSentence: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern life.

meanings.en: A confusing and difficult problem or question

exampleSentence: The mystery remained a conundrum for years.

meanings.en: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way

exampleSentence: The pernicious effects of pollution are well documented.

meanings.en: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage

exampleSentence: The boss was surrounded by sycophants who agreed with everything.

meanings.en: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class

exampleSentence: She is the quintessential professional.

meanings.en: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority

exampleSentence: The recalcitrant student refused to follow the rules.

meanings.en: Make (something bad or unsatisfactory) better

exampleSentence: The new policy aims to ameliorate working conditions.

meanings.en: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds

exampleSentence: The cacophony of car horns filled the busy street.

meanings.en: Describe or portray (something) precisely

exampleSentence: The report delineates the main issues clearly.

meanings.en: Cheerful and full of energy

exampleSentence: Her ebullient personality lights up every room.

meanings.en: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail

exampleSentence: He is fastidious about cleanliness.

meanings.en: Fond of company; sociable

exampleSentence: He is a gregarious person who loves parties.

meanings.en: Lacking significance through having been overused

exampleSentence: Avoid hackneyed phrases in your writing.

meanings.en: Acting or done quickly and without thought or care

exampleSentence: His impetuous decision cost him dearly.

meanings.en: Obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree

exampleSentence: The obsequious waiter was overly attentive.

meanings.en: (of an action or gesture) carried out with a minimum of effort or reflection

exampleSentence: He gave a perfunctory nod and continued working.

meanings.en: Exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical

exampleSentence: His quixotic quest to end all wars was admirable but impractical.

meanings.en: Optimistic or positive, especially in an apparently bad or difficult situation

exampleSentence: Despite the challenges, she remained sanguine about the future.

meanings.en: Eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant

exampleSentence: His truculent behavior made negotiations difficult.

meanings.en: (of a person) excessively or ingratiatingly flattering; oily

exampleSentence: His unctuous manner made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.en: A change of circumstances or fortune, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant

exampleSentence: Life is full of vicissitudes.

meanings.en: A thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists

exampleSentence: The typewriter is an anachronism in the digital age.

meanings.en: Hostile and aggressive

exampleSentence: The belligerent nations refused to negotiate.

meanings.en: The use of many words where fewer would do, especially in a deliberate attempt to be vague or evasive

exampleSentence: His circumlocution made it hard to understand his point.

meanings.en: Causing harm or damage

exampleSentence: Smoking has deleterious effects on health.

meanings.en: Cause (someone) to feel drained of energy or vitality; weaken

exampleSentence: The hot weather enervated everyone.

meanings.en: Pompous or extravagant in language, style, or manner

exampleSentence: His grandiloquent speech impressed no one.

meanings.en: Denoting a period of time in the past that was idly happy and peaceful

exampleSentence: She often reminisced about those halcyon days of youth.

meanings.en: Impossible to stop or prevent

exampleSentence: The inexorable march of time waits for no one.

meanings.en: Open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning

exampleSentence: The instructions were ambiguous and confusing.

meanings.en: (of a state, quality, or emotion) very great or intense

exampleSentence: The book had a profound impact on my life.

meanings.en: Having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work

exampleSentence: Diligent students often achieve their goals.

meanings.en: Of undisputed origin; genuine

exampleSentence: This restaurant serves authentic Italian cuisine.

meanings.en: Evoking interest, attention, or admiration in a powerfully irresistible way

exampleSentence: She presented a compelling argument.

meanings.en: Involving many carefully arranged parts or details; detailed and complicated in design and planning

exampleSentence: They planned an elaborate wedding ceremony.

meanings.en: (of behavior, performance, or appearance) in accordance with the highest standards of propriety; faultless

exampleSentence: Her sense of style is impeccable.

meanings.en: Arousing one's curiosity or interest; fascinating

exampleSentence: The mystery novel had an intriguing plot.

meanings.en: Producing a great deal of profit

exampleSentence: She found a lucrative career in technology.

meanings.en: Failing to take proper care in doing something

exampleSentence: The negligent driver caused the accident.

meanings.en: No longer produced or used; out of date

exampleSentence: Floppy disks are now obsolete.

meanings.en: Strange or odd; unusual

exampleSentence: There was something peculiar about his behavior.

meanings.en: Unwilling and hesitant; disinclined

exampleSentence: He was reluctant to admit his mistake.

meanings.en: Performed or occurring as a result of a sudden inner impulse or inclination and without premeditation or external stimulus

exampleSentence: Their spontaneous trip to Paris was memorable.

meanings.en: Characterized by conflict, disorder, or confusion; not controlled or calm

exampleSentence: The company went through a turbulent period.
